abstract: Rotting skeletal frame of the Calypso, famed research vessel on which French oceanographer Jacques Cousteau logged over a million nautical miles, is testimony to the fading of his memory in France; nonprofit Cousteau Society had plans to restore the vessel after the explorer's death, but lawsuits and disputes have left it weathering away in a warehouse on the western coast of France.
lead_paragraph: Jacques Cousteau’s famed research vessel has languished in a coastal French warehouse as a monetary dispute over its restoration and future drags on.

headline.main: Once a Beloved French Symbol, Cousteau’s Ship Now Rusts Into Oblivion
headline.print_headline: A Symbol of Adventure Now Slips Into Oblivion

snippet: Jacques Cousteau’s famed research vessel has languished in a coastal French warehouse as a monetary dispute over its restoration and future drags on.
